intro: Tanarius stipulosus, commonly known as the slender stipule plant, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in clusters, often in shades of pink or white. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a soft texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Tanarius stipulosus is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
